source_sentence: 「轉輪聖王，統四天下海等大地，具足七寶，乃至如法治化人民。
translation: "The wheel-turning sage king rules the four heavens, the lower sea, and other great lands, is fully endowed with the seven treasures, and thus disciplines his people.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如是等王，皆是過去轉輪聖王，具足修習無量福業，深種善根，以是果報，並得食於此四天下一切大地，受諸福樂，壽命難量，不可算計。
translation: Such kings were wheel-turning sage kings in the past who had fully cultivated measureless meritorious actions and deeply planted good roots, and as a result, they were able to eat off the whole earth under the four heavens and receive fortune and happiness with a life span that's incalculable and difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 汝等當知！
translation: You should know this!

source_sentence: 我今更說彼轉輪王，種姓苗裔，世世相承，并餘小王，子孫繼襲，住處名字，次第少多，為汝略說彼等氏族，汝等善聽！
translation: Now, I'll explain that wheel-turning king's lineage, the lineage of his descendants, the lineage of his descendants, the names of his abodes, and the order of their numbers, and I'll briefly explain their lineage for you, so listen well!

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 大須彌王，治化已來，世世相承，子子孫孫，有一百一小轉輪王，悉皆住在褒多那城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: Since his rule and transformation, the great King Sumeru has passed from generation to generation, and his descendants have had a hundred and one wheel-turning kings, all of whom have lived in the city of Bātāna, ruling and transforming the people and enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 彼諸王內，最後一王，名師子乘。
translation: Among those kings, the last one was named Shizi-hyana.

source_sentence: 師子乘王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有六十一小轉輪王，悉皆住在波羅[木*奈]城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, the Shisishya kings have been succeeded by their sons and grandsons, and there are 61 minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Bālāta [munai], rule the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名曰女乘。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is called the female vehicle king.

source_sentence: 彼女乘王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有五十六小轉輪王，悉皆住在阿踰闍城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that woman-vehicle king has descendants and fifty-six minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Ayodhyā, rule the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名嚴熾生。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is named Yan Zhisheng.

source_sentence: 嚴熾生王，世世相承，子子孫孫，合有一千小轉輪王，皆悉住在迦毘梨耶城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, King Yan Zhisheng's lineage has descended from son to son, and there are 1,000 minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Kapilavastu, rule the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名曰梵德。
translation: "The last of those kings is named Brahmā the Virtuous.

source_sentence: 彼梵德王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，皆悉住在阿私帝那富羅城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that King Brahmadeva succeeded his sons and grandsons, and there were twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom lived in the city of Asita-dinapura, ruled the people, and enjoyed well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名為象將。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one was named General Elephant.

source_sentence: 彼象將王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，皆悉住在德叉尸羅城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that general elephant king's lineage has descended from son to son, and there are twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Takṣaśīla, govern the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，號名為護。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is called the Protector King.

source_sentence: 而彼護王，世世相承，子子孫孫，一千二百小轉輪王，皆悉住在奢耶那城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, his descendants, 1,200 minor wheel-turning kings, all of them living in the city of Śāyana, rule the people and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名能降伏。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is called the king who subdues.

source_sentence: 能降伏王，世世相承，子子孫孫，合有九十小轉輪王，皆悉住在迦那鳩闍城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: Those kings who are able to subdue him will continue from generation to generation, and their descendants, numbering 90 lesser wheel-turning kings, will all live in the city of Kanakauja, govern the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名為勝將。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one was named VICTORIOUS GENERAL.

source_sentence: 彼勝將王，世世相承，子子孫孫，二千五百小轉輪王，皆悉住在於瞻波城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that victorious general king has been succeeded by his sons and grandsons, and 2,500 minor wheel-turning kings all live in the city of Campā, governing the people and enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名曰龍天。
translation: "The last of those kings is named Nāgârjuna.

source_sentence: 彼龍天王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，皆悉住在於王舍城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that last king of the dragon gods has descended from his sons and grandsons, and there are 25 lesser wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Rājagṛha, rule the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名為作闍。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is named Zaojajie.

source_sentence: 彼作闍王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，皆悉住在拘尸那竭城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that king, the successor of that successor, had twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom lived in the city of Kuśinagara, ruled the people, and enjoyed well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名大自在天。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is named Mahêśvara.

source_sentence: 彼大自在天王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，悉皆住在菴婆羅劫波城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that Mahêśvara god king has descendants and twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Ambālākapāla, governing the people and enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，還名大自在天。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is still called the Mahātejas garuḍêndra.

source_sentence: 彼大自在天王世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，悉皆住在檀多富羅城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that Mahātejas garuḍêndra king has descendants and twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom live in the city of Dantapura, govern the people, and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名曰善意。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is named Good Will.

source_sentence: 彼善意王，世世相承，子子孫孫，有二十五小轉輪王，悉皆住在多摩婆頗梨多城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that King Good Will had descendants and twenty-five minor wheel-turning kings, all of whom lived in the city of Dharmapālita, ruled the people, and enjoyed well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名無憂鬘。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one was named Wuzu Garland.

source_sentence: 彼無憂鬘王，世世相承，子子孫孫，八萬四千小轉輪王，皆悉住在寐(亡私反)洟(他梨反)羅城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, his descendants, 84,000 minor wheel-turning kings, all of them living in the city of Mañjuśrī, govern the people and enjoy well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名毗紐天。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is named Viṣṇu.

source_sentence: 彼毗紐天王，世世相承，子子孫孫，一百一王，皆悉住在毗褒多那城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, his descendants, a hundred and one kings, all live in the city of Vipaṭona, tending the people and enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，還名大自在天。
translation: "The last of those kings was also called the Mahêśvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 彼大自在天王，世世相承，子子孫孫，合有八萬四千諸王，還在於彼寐(亡私反)洟(他梨反)羅城治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, that Mahātejas garuḍêndra king has descendants, numbering 84,000 kings, who are still in that city of Mañjuśrī, ruling the people and enjoying well-being.

source_sentence: 「彼諸王內，最後一王，名曰魚王。
translation: "Among those kings, the last one is called the Fish King.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 當知諸如是等小轉輪王，悉有福德，皆種善根，具足受於世間福報，無與等者，其化所被，大地及海一切諸山，悉皆統攝。
translation: You should know that such small wheel-turning kings are all blessed, all have good roots, are fully endowed with the world's merits, and have no equal, and the earth and all the mountains of the ocean that they conjure up are all included.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 彼轉輪王，各各皆有粟散諸王，我今說之。
translation: Each of those wheel-turning kings has a scattering of kings, which I'll now explain.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: "Monks!

source_sentence: 魚王有子，名曰真生。
translation: The fish king had a son named Trisheng.

source_sentence: 彼真生王父祖已來，修習善根，得紹繼王，福報盡故，便失王位。
translation: After cultivating good roots since his father's ancestors, that king Trisheng succeeded to the throne and lost his throne when his rewards of merit ended.

source_sentence: 時人見彼王化失道無有福德，共相謂言：『此王人中最好貧劣，人中單薄，人中可愍，人中可掘。』
translation: When people saw that the king had lost his way and had no virtue, they all said to each other, 'This king is the best of men, poor and meager among men, pitiable among men, and diggable among men.'

source_sentence: 是故世人皆號之為可掘之王。
translation: That's why the world calls him the diggable king.

source_sentence: 掘王有子，名為平等行王，平等行王子名闇火，闇火王子名為焰熾，焰熾王子名為善譬，善譬王子名為虛空，虛空王子名為戒行，戒行王子名為無憂，無憂王子名為離憂，離憂王子名為除憂，除憂王子名為勝將，勝將王子名為大將，大將王子名為胎生，胎生王子名為明星，明星王子名為方主，方主王子號名為塵，彼塵王子名為善意，善意王子名為善住，善住王子名為歡喜，歡喜王子名為大力，大力王子名為大光，大光王子名大名稱，大名稱王子名為十車，十車王子名二十車，二十車王子名為妙車，妙車王子名為步車，步車王子名為十弓，十弓王子名為百弓，百弓王子名二十弓，二十弓王子名妙色弓，妙色弓王子名為罪弓，罪弓王子名為海將，海將王子名為難勝，難勝王子名為茅草，茅草王子名大茅草。
translation: 掘王有子，名為平等行王，平等行王子名闇火，闇火王子名為焰熾，焰熾王子名為善譬，善譬王子名為虛空，虛空王子名為戒行，戒行王子名為無憂，無憂王子名為離憂，離憂王子名為除憂，除憂王子名為勝將，勝將王子名為大將，大將王子名為胎生，胎生王子名為明星，明星王子名為方主，方主王子號名為塵，彼塵王子名為善意，善意王子名為善住，善住王子名為歡喜，歡喜王子名為大力，大力王子名為大光，大光王子名大名稱，大名稱王子名為十車，十車王子名二十車，二十車王子名為妙車，妙車王子名為步車，步車王子名為十弓，十弓王子名為百弓，百弓王子名二十弓，二十弓王子名妙色弓，妙色弓王子名為罪弓，罪弓王子名為海將，海將王子名為難勝，難勝王子名為茅草，茅草王子名大茅草。

source_sentence: 大茅草王，世世相承，子子孫孫，苗裔合有一百八王，還住在彼褒多那城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: From generation to generation, the great thatch-grass king's lineage descended from son to son, and there were 108 kings who lived in that city of Bātāna, ruling and educating the people and enjoying their welfare.

source_sentence: 「彼一百八，最在後王大茅草者，其王無子，作如是念：『上世已來，我之種姓，粟散諸王，見自頭鬚生白髮時，各以諸子，灌頂為王，別取勝上最好一州，以用布施；剃除鬚髮，捨於王位，出家修道。
translation: "One hundred and eight of those latter kings, the most venerable of the great thatch kings, had no sons, and he thought, 'In a past life, when the scattered kings of my lineage saw their hair grow white on their beards, they each gave their sons the consecration to be king, took a state that was superior to the best, and gave it as an offering; they shaved off their hair, left their position as king, and left home to cultivate.

source_sentence: 我今無兒，當以誰繼嗣我王後？
translation: Now that I have no sons, who will succeed me as king?

source_sentence: 誰堪增長我之種姓？
translation: Who can increase my seed-nature?

source_sentence: 或復我今斷諸王種？』
translation: Or have I now cut off the seeds of kings?'

source_sentence: 復生此念：『我今若不出家修道，則斷一切諸賢聖種。』
translation: "Again, he had this thought, 'If I don't leave home and train now, I'll cut off all the seeds of goodness and holiness.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，時，大茅草即以王位，付諸大臣。
translation: After he thought this, the great thatch then took the king's position and gave it to his ministers.

source_sentence: 大眾圍繞，送王出城，剃除鬚髮，服出家衣。
translation: Surrounded by a large crowd, they escorted the king out of the city, shaved off his hair, and put on the renunciant's robes.

source_sentence: 王出家已，持戒清淨，專心勇猛，成就四禪，具足五通，得成王仙，壽命極長。
translation: After leaving home, the king observed pure precepts, concentrated his mind and had courage, accomplished the four meditations, and perfected the five powers, becoming a royal sage with a very long life.

source_sentence: 至年衰老，肉消背曲，雖復柱杖，不能遠行。
translation: When he reached old age, his flesh disappeared and his back was bent, and even though he had a staff, he couldn't travel far.

source_sentence: 時彼王仙，諸弟子等，欲往東西，求覓飲食，取好軟草，安置籠裏，用盛王仙，懸樹枝上。
translation: When the king's sage and his disciples wanted to go east or west to find something to eat, they took some nice, soft grass, put it in a cage, filled it with the king's sage, and hung it from a tree branch.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 畏諸蟲獸來觸王仙。
translation: They were afraid that some insect or animal would come in contact with the king's sage.

source_sentence: 時諸弟子，乞食去後，有一獵師，遊行山野，遙見王仙，謂是白鳥，遂即射之。
translation: After the disciples had left to solicit alms, a hunter roamed the hills and fields, saw the king's sage from a distance, said it was a white bird, and shot it.

source_sentence: 時彼王仙，既被射已，有兩渧血出墮於地，即便命終。
translation: After he was shot, two drops of his blood fell to the ground, and he was killed.

source_sentence: 彼諸弟子，乞食來還，見彼王仙被射命終，復見有血兩渧在地，即下彼籠，將王置地，集聚柴木，焚燒王屍，收骨為塔，復將種種雜妙香華，供養彼塔，尊重讚歎，承事畢了。
translation: Those disciples who had come back from begging for food saw the king's sage shot to death and saw two drops of blood on the ground, so they lowered the king into a cage, put him on the ground, gathered firewood, burned his corpse, gathered his bones into a stūpa, and then placed a variety of wonderful incense and flowers in an offering to the stūpa, honoring and praising him, and finishing their duties.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼地有兩渧血，即便生出二苷蔗，芽漸漸高大，至時蔗熟，日炙開剖，其一莖蔗，出一童子，更一莖蔗，出一童女，端政可憙，世無有雙。
translation: At the time, two drops of blood on that ground immediately produced two stalks of cane, whose sprouts gradually grew taller and bigger, and when the cane was ripe, it was roasted and cut open, and from one stalk of cane came a young boy, and from another stalk of cane came a young woman, whose appearance was so dignified and admirable that there was no equal in the world.

source_sentence: 時諸弟子，心念王仙在世之時，不生兒子，今此兩童，是王仙種。
translation: The disciples then thought to themselves, "When the king's sage was alive, he didn't give birth to sons; now these two children are the king's sage seed.

source_sentence: 養護看視，報諸臣知。
translation: They guarded, watched, and reported them to their ministers.

source_sentence: 時，諸大臣聞已歡喜，往至彼林，迎二童子，將還入宮，召喚解相大婆羅門，教令占相并遣作名。
translation: When the ministers heard this, they rejoiced and went to the forest, welcomed the two boys, returned to the palace, summoned the great Brahmin who understood their signs, taught them to divine their signs, and sent them away to be named.

source_sentence: 彼相師言：『此童子者，既是日炙熟苷蔗開而出生故，一名善生；又以其從苷蔗出故，第二復名苷蔗生；又以日炙苷蔗出故，亦名日種。
translation: The fortune teller said, 'This boy was born from the opening of sun-scorched ripened glucosamine cane, so he's called a good birth; he's also known as a glucosamine cane birth because he emerged from glucosamine cane; and he's also known as a sun-seed because he emerged from sun-scorched glucosamine cane.

source_sentence: 彼女因緣一種無異故，名善賢，復名水波。』
translation: Because that woman's causes and conditions are not different from one another, she's called Good Samaritan and, furthermore, she's called Water Wave.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸臣取苷蔗種所生童子，幼少年時，即灌其頂，立以為王；其善賢女，至年長大，堪能伏事，即拜為王第一之妃。
translation: Those ministers then took a young child born from the glucosinia seed, and when he was a young boy, they put his head in water and made him king; when she was old enough to subdue her, she was worshipped as the king's first consort by that good-hearted woman.

source_sentence: 「時苷蔗王，有第二妃，絕妙端政，生於四子：一名炬面，二名金色，三名象眾，四名別成。
translation: "King Gṛdhrakūṭa then had a second consort, a woman of marvelous qualities, who gave birth to four sons: one torch-faced, two golden, three elephant-people, and four separately formed.

source_sentence: 其善賢妃，唯生一子，名為長壽，端政可憙，世間少雙，然其骨相，不堪作王。
translation: The wife of Goodness gave birth to only one son named Long Life, whose dignity and grace are rarely matched in the world, but whose bones and features make him unfit to be king.

source_sentence: 時善賢妃，如是思惟：『苷蔗種王，有此四子，炬面等輩，兄弟群強，我今唯有此之一子，雖極端正世無有雙，然其相分，不堪為主。
translation: The good consort then thought, 'Thus did the sugarcane king have these four sons, who are torch-faced and strong in brotherhood, but now I have only this one son who, though perfectly correct and unmatched in the world, has features that make him unfit to be a lord.

source_sentence: 作何方便，令我此子得紹王位？』
translation: What method will I use to allow this son of mine to assume the position of king?'

source_sentence: 復作此念：『是苷蔗王，今於我邊，無量敬愛，深心染著，縱情蕩意。
translation: "Again, he thinks, 'Now, this is the Glucosamine King, who is endlessly adored by me, deeply attached, and dissipated in spirit.

source_sentence: 我今可更窮極婦人莊飾之法，所謂淨潔摩拭身體，香湯沐浴，使氣芬芳，髮塗澤蘭，面著脂粉，花鬘瓔珞，種種莊嚴，令苷蔗王心於我邊重生耽湎愛戀娛樂。
translation: Now, may I further elaborate on the ways a woman adorns herself, which are to cleanse and wipe her body, bathe her in scented baths to make her breath smell nice, coat her hair with zebran, put fat on her face, and wear flowers and jewelry, and make her adorn herself in various ways, so that King Glucosamine's mind will again become engrossed in love and amusement at my side?

source_sentence: 若得如心，我於屏處，當乞求願。』
translation: If I could have such a mind, I would beg and vow for it at my screened-in place.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，如上所說，莊嚴自身，令極殊絕，至於王邊。
translation: After thinking about this, he adorned himself as described above, making him extremely desirable and reaching the king's side.

source_sentence: 王見妃來，生重愛敬，縱逸其心。
translation: When the king saw the consort coming, he held her in high esteem and indulged her mind.

source_sentence: 妃見王生如是心已，二人眠臥，妃白王言：『大王當知，我今從王，乞求一願，願王與我。』
translation: After she saw that the king had developed such a mind, they both slept and lay down, and she said to the king, 'You must know, Your Highness, that I've asked the king for one vow, and I wish that the king would grant it to me.'

source_sentence: 王言：『大妃！
translation: The king said, 'Grand Mistress!

source_sentence: 隨意不逆，從心所欲，我當與妃。』
translation: Do as you wish and don't oppose it; do as your heart desires, and I will give it to the princess.'

source_sentence: 時妃復更重諮王言：『大王自在若與我願，不得變悔，若變悔者，我不須此。』
translation: The consort then repeatedly consulted the king, saying, 'If the king freely grants my wish, he mustn't change his mind; if he does, I won't need it.'

source_sentence: 王語妃言：『我一與妃心之所願，後若悔者，當令我頭破作七分。』
translation: The king said to the princess, 'Once I grant you what your heart desires, if you later repent, it will cause my head to be split into seven parts.'

source_sentence: 妃言：『大王！
translation: The princess said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 王之四子，炬面等輩，願擯出國，遣我生子長壽為王。』
translation: The king's four sons, of the torch-faced variety, wished to be sent away from their country and to have my sons born to live a long life as kings.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，即語妃言：『我此四子，無有過失，不橫求財，無有罪患，豈可無辜抂得駈遣遠擯他土？
translation: King Glucosamine then said to his wife, 'These four sons of mine are without fault, don't seek wealth unscrupulously, and aren't in danger of harm.

source_sentence: 於我治化國境之內，有何非祥不聽其住？』
translation: What's so ominous about not listening to them while they're within the borders of the country I'm governing and teaching?'

source_sentence: 妃又白言：『王已先誓，語若悔者頭破七分。』
translation: The princess then said, 'The king has previously vowed that if he repents, his head will be split seven ways.'

source_sentence: 王告妃言：『我如前言與妃所願，妃若知時，任隨妃意。』
translation: The king told her, 'I did as I said before and gave her what she wanted; if she knows it, she can do as she wishes.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，過此夜後，至明清旦，集聚四子，而告勅言：『汝四童子！
translation: After the night passed, the king of the grapes gathered his four sons at sunrise and told them, 'You four boys!

source_sentence: 今可出去我治化內，不得居住，遠向他國。』
translation: Now, you may leave my dominion and transform it into a place where you can't live and go far away to another country.'

source_sentence: 「時四童子，胡跪合掌，白父王言：『大王！
translation: "The four boys then knelt down with their palms together and said to their father, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知我等四人，無有罪惡，無諸過咎，不作非法取他錢財，又復不造其餘惡業，云何父王，忽然擯我出於國界？』
translation: You should know that the four of us are not guilty of evil, have no faults, do not illegally take another's money or property, and do not commit any other bad acts, so why did my father suddenly send me away from the kingdom?'

source_sentence: 王勅子言：『我知汝等實無過失，不橫取財，如上所說，此非我意，駈擯於汝。
translation: The king commanded his son, "I know that you really have no faults and don't take wealth unjustly, as I said, but this is not my intention, so I'll leave it to you.

source_sentence: 此是善賢大妃之意。
translation: This is the wish of the good and virtuous princess.

source_sentence: 彼妃乞願，我不違彼，令汝出國。』
translation: I won't disobey her if she asks me to let you leave the country.'

source_sentence: 時四王子所生之母，聞苷蔗王，欲擯其子令出國界，聞已速疾往至王所。
translation: When the mother of the fourth prince heard that King Glucosamine wanted to send his son away from the country, she quickly went to the king after hearing that.

source_sentence: 至王所已，白言大王：『聞王欲逐我之四子，令出國界，為實爾不？』
translation: When she arrived, she said to the king, 'Is it true that you heard the king wanted to expel my four sons and make them leave the kingdom?'

source_sentence: 王言：『實遣。』
translation: The king said, 'They're really dismissed.'

source_sentence: 諸妃各復白於王言：『善哉！
translation: Each of the ladies then said to the king, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 我等各求乞隨兒去。』
translation: We each asked that you follow us.'

source_sentence: 「王報諸妃：『隨汝意去。』
translation: "The king then reported to the concubines, 'Go as you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸妃妹復白王言：『我姊[外*男]甥，今既出國，我亦乞去。』
translation: The concubines then again said to the king, 'Now that my sister [foreigner*nephew] has left the country, I also beg to go.'

source_sentence: 王各報言：『任隨汝意。』
translation: The king then replied to each of them, 'Do as you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸大臣公卿輔相，亦白王言：『王今斥遣此四王子，令出國者，我等諸臣，亦求隨去。』
translation: The ministers, ministers, and ministers-in-chief also said to the king, 'Now that the king has sent these four princes away from the country, we ministers also request that they go with them.'

source_sentence: 王言：『任意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 時王典當諸象馬臣，亦求隨從，王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king's officers and ministers of elephants and horses then also asked to follow them, and the king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 復有弓將弩將獄將、諸典當羊畜牧等將、諸臣之子，又復諸餘主藏兵將、遊軍壯士善射之將，奴婢僕使及其子等，聞苷蔗王欲逐四子，令出國界，俱白王言：『我等並求隨從王子東西而去。』
translation: Furthermore, when the king heard that the bow-general, the crossbow-general, the prison general, the canonical sheep herd, the sons of the ministers, the other lords, the general of the hidden army, the commander of the strong men who shoot well, the slaves, the servants, the messengers, and their sons wanted to expel their four sons and make them leave the country, they all said to the king, 'We also request to follow the prince's east and west.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 又復國內竹匠，皮匠，瓦師，塼師，造屋木師，造酒食師，剃鬚髮師，染洗衣師，屠兒，按摩，治病，合藥，釣魚等師，聞王欲駈四子出國：『審如是不？』
translation: Also, when the king heard that he wanted to expel his four sons from the country, he asked them, 'Shouldn't he do that?'

source_sentence: 王言：『實爾。』
translation: The king said, 'It's true.'

source_sentence: 『我等求去。』
translation: 'We're asking to leave.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，勅諸王子，作如是言：『汝等王子！
translation: Then King Gṛdhrakūṭa commanded the princes, saying, 'You princes!

source_sentence: 從今已去，若欲婚姻，不得餘處取他外族，還於自家姓內而取，莫令苷蔗種姓斷絕。』
translation: From now on, if you want to marry, you mustn't take another clan from elsewhere; instead, take it from within your own family, so you don't cut off the glucosamine lineage.'

source_sentence: 時，諸王子白父王言：『如大王勅。』
translation: The princes then said to their father, 'As the king has commanded.'

source_sentence: 「彼諸王子，受父教已，各各自將所生之母，并姨姊妹、奴婢資財、諸馱乘等，即向北方到雪山下，經少時住，有一大河，名婆耆羅洟，渡於彼河，上雪山頂，遊涉久停。
translation: "After they had been instructed by their father, each of those princes took his mother, his aunts and sisters, his slave's property, and his dhāraṇīs, and so forth, and went north to the base of Mount Snowdon, where they stayed for a short time.

source_sentence: 時四王子，在彼山頂，射獵捕諸禽獸而食，漸漸前行，至山南面，見川寬平，無諸坑坎堆阜陵谷丘壑溝渠、荊棘塵埃及沙礫等，其地唯生軟細青草，清淨可愛，樹林花果，蔚茂敷榮，猶如黑雲，光澤儵鑠。
translation: At the time, the four princes were on the top of that mountain, shooting and hunting for food from the animals, and they gradually went on to the south side of the mountain, where they saw a wide, level river, with no pits or hills, valleys, gullies, ditches, thorns, dust, Egypt, sand, or gravel, and the only thing growing on the ground was soft, fine grass that was pure and lovely, and trees, forests, flowers, and fruit that were luxuriant and flourishing like black clouds with a shining luster.

source_sentence: 林木遍滿，其間少空，所謂娑羅樹、多羅樹、那多摩羅樹、阿說他樹、尼拘陀樹、優曇婆羅樹、千年棗樹、迦梨羅樹等，垂諸枝柯，各相蔭映。
translation: The forest is filled with trees, and there's little space between them, such as the śāla tree, the tārā tree, the nātamālā tree, the asarta tree, the nyagrodha tree, the udumbara tree, the thousand-year-old jujube tree, and the karīra tree, each with its own branches and branches shading the other.

source_sentence: 又有種種諸雜妙花，所謂阿提目多華、瞻波華、阿輸迦華、波多羅花、婆利師迦華、拘蘭那華、拘毘陀羅花、檀奴沙迦梨迦花、目真隣陀華、蘇摩那等，一切諸華，或有已開，或有未開，或初欲開，或開已落。
translation: There are also a variety of wonderful flowers, such as the adhimukti flower, the campaka flower, the aśoka flower, the portulaca flower, the pārishika flower, the kulana flower, the kovidāra flower, the dānusakārikā flower, the mucilinda flower, and the sumāna flower, all of which may or may not have blossomed, may or may not have blossomed, may or may not be about to blossom, or may or may not have blossomed and fallen.

source_sentence: 復有無量眾雜果樹，所謂菴婆羅果、閻浮果、陵拘闍果、波那婆果、鎮頭迦果、呵梨勒果、毘醯勒果、阿摩勒等，種種諸果，或始結子，或子欲熟，或子已熟，堪可食噉。
translation: There are also measureless varieties of fruit trees, such as the fruit of umbhra, the fruit of jambu, the fruit of lingkoja, the fruit of pāṇḍaka, the fruit of hariṇa, the fruit of vihī, and the fruit of amalā, which sometimes begin to bear fruit, sometimes have seeds that are about to ripen, and sometimes have ripened seeds that are ready to be devoured.

source_sentence: 「復有無量諸雜野獸，所謂伊泥耶獸，麞鹿水牛，那羅迦獸，野牛白象，及師子等。
translation: "There are also measureless varieties of wild animals, such as the animal of the forest, the deer and buffalo, the animal of the Nārāga, the wild ox and white elephant, and the lion.

source_sentence: 復有無量種種飛鳥，所謂鸚鵡，及拘翅羅、鸜鵒孔雀、迦陵頻伽、命命鵁鶄、山鷄白鶴、遮摩迦鳥，及蘭摩等一切雜鳥。
translation: There are also measureless numbers of flying birds, such as parrots, kokila, peacocks, kalaviṅka, raccoons, chickadees, cranes, caymakas, and other birds of prey such as the lama.

source_sentence: 復有無量諸水，陂池其池，各有種種雜花，所謂優鉢羅華、波頭摩花、拘勿頭華、分陀利華，悉滿諸池池岸四邊。
translation: There are also measureless rivers and raging pools, each with a variety of flowers called the upādhara flower, the padma flower, the kovidāra flower, and the puṇḍarīka flower, which fill the four sides of the pools.

source_sentence: 復有諸華，垂覆池上，其水清淨，無有濁穢，湛然彌滿，不深不淺，易度易行，周匝四邊，種種諸樹。
translation: There are also flowers that hang down over the pond, and their water is pure and unsullied, perfectly filled, neither deep nor shallow, easy to navigate, and surrounded by various trees on all sides.

source_sentence: 池內復有種種諸虫，所謂魚鼈黿鼉龜鼇螺蜂，一切水性。
translation: Also in the pond are various insects, called fish, aquatic animals, turtle, tortoise, and conch, all of which are watery.

source_sentence: 復有小鳥，所謂鳧鴈鵝鴨、白鷺鸕鶿及鴛鴦等，一切諸鳥。
translation: There are also small birds, such as ducks, geese, geese, ducks, egrets, cormorants, and cormorants, and all the other birds.

source_sentence: 然其彼處，舊有一仙，在中居止，名迦毘羅。
translation: Still, there used to be a sage there named Kapila who lived in the middle of the place and stayed there.

source_sentence: 彼諸王子，見是處已，共相謂言：『可於此間造城治化。』
translation: Those princes, after seeing this place, said to each other, 'This is a place where you can build a city and train people.'

source_sentence: 「爾時王子既安住已，憶父王語，於自姓中，求覓婚姻，不能得婦，各納姨母及其姊妹，共為夫妻。
translation: "After they had settled down, the princes remembered their father's words and looked for a wife among their own family, but when they couldn't find one, they each took their aunt and sister to be husband and wife.

source_sentence: 依於婦禮，一欲隨從父王教令，二恐釋種雜亂相生。
translation: They relied on the propriety of a wife because they first wanted to follow their father's instructions, and second, they were afraid that the interpretative seeds would be mixed up and give rise to mutual confusion.

source_sentence: 爾時，日種苷蔗之王，召一國師大婆羅門，來謂之言：『大婆羅門！
translation: It was then that the king of the sun-seeded glycosides summoned a national teacher, the great brāhmaṇa, who came to him and said, 'Great brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 我四王子，今在何處？』
translation: Where is my fourth prince now?'

source_sentence: 國師答言：『大王！
translation: The king's teacher replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知王之四子，已各自將母姨姊妹馱乘人物，遠出國外，向於北方，乃至已生端政男女。』
translation: 'You should know that four of the king's sons have each sent their mothers, aunts, and sisters away in vehicles and figures, far away from home and to the north, even to the point where they have produced well-adjusted sons and daughters.'

source_sentence: 時苷蔗王，為自所愛諸王子故，心思欲見，意情歡喜，而發是言：『彼諸王子，能立國計，大好治化。』
translation: Then, because of his beloved princes, King Gṛdhrakūṭa, his mind desired to see them, and his thoughts were joyous as he said, 'Those princes are capable of setting up a plan for the country and are very good at governing and transforming it.'

source_sentence: 彼等王子，是故立姓，稱為釋迦。
translation: Those princes were therefore given a family name, Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 以釋迦住大樹蓊蔚枝條之下，是故名為奢夷耆耶。
translation: Because the Śākyamuni lives under the luxuriant branches of a great tree, he's therefore called Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 以其本於迦毘羅仙處所住故，因城立名，故名迦毘羅婆蘇都。
translation: Because he originally lived at Kapilavastu, he was named Kapilavastu because of the city's name.

source_sentence: 「時苷蔗王三子沒後，唯一子在，名尼拘羅(隋言別成)，為王住在迦毘羅城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: "When the three sons of King Gṛdhrakūṭa had perished, his only living son, named Nigrodhara (Sui term for separately accomplished), was the king who lived in Kapilavastu and ruled the people, enjoying their welfare and happiness.

source_sentence: 其尼拘羅王，生於一子，名曰拘盧，還在父王迦毘羅城，治化而住。
translation: Then King Nigrodha gave birth to a son named Kulo, who remained in his father's city of Kapilavastu, ruled, and educated the people, and lived there.

source_sentence: 其拘盧王，復生一子，名瞿拘盧，亦在父城，為王治化。
translation: King Kauṇḍinya then gave birth to another son named Kauṇḍinya, who also stayed in his father's city and ruled and educated the king.

source_sentence: 其瞿拘盧王，復生一子，名師子頰，還在父城，治化人民。
translation: Then another son, named Gokulo, was born to King Gokulo, named Shizi Cheeks, who remained in his father's city and ruled and educated the people.

source_sentence: 師子頰王，生於四子：第一名曰閱頭檀王(隋言淨飯)，第二名為輸拘盧檀那(隋言白飯)，第三名為途盧檀那(隋言斛飯)，第四名為阿彌都檀那(隋言甘露飯)，復有一女，名甘露味。
translation: King Shizi Cheeks then gave birth to four sons: the first was King Nandana (Sui term for pure rice), the second was Śuklôdana (Sui term for white rice), the third was Tūlôdana (Sui term for dried rice), the fourth was Amṛtôdana (Sui term for nectarine rice), and he had a daughter named Nectarine Flavor.

source_sentence: 師子頰王，最初長子閱頭檀者，次紹王位，還在父城，治化人民，受於福樂。
translation: The first eldest son of King Shizi-cheeks, Nandana, was the next to assume the throne, remained in his father's city, ruled and educated the people, and enjoyed well-being.

source_sentence: 「時迦毘羅，相去不遠，復有一城，名曰天臂。
translation: "Then, not far from Kapila, there was another city named Celestial Arm.

source_sentence: 彼天臂城，有一釋種，豪貴長者，名為善覺，大富多財，積諸珍寶，資產豐饒，具足威德，稱意自然，無所乏少，舍宅猶如毘沙門王宮殿無異。
translation: In that city of Celestial Arm, there was a noble elder of the Śākyas lineage named Well-Awakened, who was very wealthy and abundant in possessions, accumulated treasures, had an abundance of assets, was fully endowed with authority, had a natural inclination, and had no lack, and whose residence was like the palace of King Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 彼釋長者，生於八女：一名為意，二名無比意，三名大意，四名無邊意，五名髻意，六名黑牛，七名瘦牛，八名摩訶波闍波提(隋言大慧亦云梵天)。
translation: That eldest Śākyamuni gave birth to eight women: one with will, two with peerless will, three with great will, four with limitless will, five with topknotted will, six with black oxen, seven with lean oxen, and eight with Mahāprajāpatī (Sui term for great wisdom also called Brahmā).

source_sentence: 而此梵天，於諸女中，年最幼小，初生之日，為諸能相婆羅門師，觀占其體，云：『此女嫁若生兒者，必當得作轉輪聖王，王四天下，七寶自然，千子具足，乃至不用鞭杖治民。』
translation: When this Brahma goddess was first born, she was the youngest of all the women, and on the day she was first born, she was observed by a master Brahmin who had the ability to divine her body and said, 'If this woman marries a son, she will surely become a wheel-turning sage king who will rule the whole world with seven treasures and a thousand sons, even if she doesn't use a whip and stick to rule the people.'

source_sentence: 時善覺女，年漸長成，堪欲行嫁。
translation: The well-enlightened woman then was growing up and ready to get married.

source_sentence: 白淨王聞自國境內有一釋氏，甚大豪富，生於八女，端政少雙，乃至相師占觀其女，當生貴子。
translation: King Jingbai heard that there was a Śākyamuni woman within his kingdom who was very wealthy and had eight daughters, who were well-groomed and had few parents, and whose daughter had been divined by a fortune teller as being likely to give birth to a valuable son.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王聞是語已，作如是言：『我今當索是女作妃，令我苷蔗轉輪聖王苗裔不絕(此是律家作如是說。
translation: After hearing this, King Jīvaka said, 'Now, I will claim that woman as my consort so that my sons will not be cut off from the wheel-turning sage king.' (This is what the Vinaya experts say.)

source_sentence: 又言大慧是菩薩母者，此依阿波陀那經文。
translation: This is based on the text of the Apadāna sūtras, which also says that Dahui is the mother of the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 又言輸頭檀王是我之父、摩耶夫人是我之母，如阿波陀那經說。
translation: He also said that King Śuddhodana is my father and Lady Māyā is my mother, as explained in the Apadāna sūtras.

source_sentence: 撿諸經文，此義是實)。』
translation: Looking at the sutras, this meaning is true.)'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王即遣使人，往詣善覺大長者家，求索大慧，為我作於波闍波提(波闍波提者隋言生活本)。
translation: "It was then that King Jōtō sent an envoy to visit the home of the great elder Sunetra and ask for great wisdom to make a baja-bodhi for me (baja-bodhi is Sui term for living book).

source_sentence: 爾時，善覺語彼使言：『善使仁者，為我諮啟大王是言：「我有八女，一名為意，乃至第八名為大慧。
translation: It was then that Sunetra said to the messenger, 'Good sir, consult the great king for me, saying, 'I have eight women, one of whom is named Maitreya, and the eighth is named Dahui.

source_sentence: 何故大王求最小者？
translation: Why is it that the great king seeks the youngest?

source_sentence: 大王且可待我處分七女竟已，當與大王大慧作妃。」』
translation: You may wait until I've finished with the seven daughters, then I'll give the king Mahākauṣṭhila Mahākauṣṭhila as my consort."

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王復更遣使語長者言：『我今不得待汝一一嫁七女訖，然後取於大慧作妃，汝八頭女，我盡皆取。』
translation: The king of Jīvaka then sent another envoy to tell the elder, 'Now, I won't allow you to marry each of the seven daughters until I've finished with them, and then I'll take Dahui as my consort, and I'll take all eight of your daughters.'

source_sentence: 時，善覺釋報大王言：『若如是者，依大王命，隨意將去。』
translation: Sunetra then reported to the king, saying, 'If that's the case, follow the king's order and go as you like.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王即遣使人，一時迎取八女向宮。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then sent an envoy to fetch eight daughters to the palace at once.

source_sentence: 至於宮已，即納二女，自用為妃，其二女者，第一名為意，及以第八名大慧者。
translation: Once he arrived at the palace, he took two women and made them his concubines, the first of whom was Will, and the eighth was named Mahākauṣṭhila.

source_sentence: 自餘六女，分與三弟，一人與二並妻為妃。
translation: The other six daughters were given to three brothers, one of whom took two wives as his concubine.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王納意姊妹，內於宮中，縱情嬉戲，歡娛受樂，依諸王法，治化四方。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then took his sisters, Yi and Hu, into his palace, where they enjoyed themselves, had fun, enjoyed themselves, and ruled and educated the four directions according to the king's laws.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經上託兜率品第四上
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Fourth and Foremost in the Tuṣita Chapter

source_sentence: 「爾時，護明菩薩大士，從於迦葉佛世尊所護持禁戒，梵行清淨，命終之後，正念往生兜率陀天。
translation: "At the time, the great luminous protector Bodhisattva guarded the precepts and maintained a pure religious practice under the tutelage of the Bhagavān Kāśyapa, and when his life ended, he was correctly mindful that he would be reborn in the Tuṣita Heaven.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 或有眾生，命終之日，為於風刀，節節支解，受於楚痛，或氣欲盡，喘息不安，以是因緣，受大苦惱，失於本心，忘其宿行，不能專正寂定其心。
translation: Perhaps there's a sentient being who, on the day his life ends, is torn limb by limb by a wind knife, experiences pain, or has a desire to end his breath, and becomes restless; as a result, he experiences great suffering and distress, loses sight of his original mind, forgets his past actions, and can't concentrate and calm his mind.

source_sentence: 菩薩不然，命欲終日，正心思惟，緣其前世託生處所，有如是等希奇之法。
translation: Otherwise, when a bodhisattva is about to reach the end of his life, he correctly reflects on this rare thing in reference to the place where he was reborn in a previous life.

source_sentence: 又諸菩薩，復有一法，命終之後，必生天上，或高或下，不定一天；而其一生補處菩薩，多必往生兜率陀天，心生歡喜，智慧滿足。
translation: Furthermore, there's another thing about bodhisattvas that when their life ends, they'll surely be born up in the heavens, whether high or low, for an indeterminate day, but bodhisattvas in the vicinity of their lifetime will most often be born in the Tuṣita Heaven, rejoicing in their hearts and fulfilling their wisdom.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 在下諸天，多有放逸，上界諸天，禪定力多，寂定軟弱，不求於生，以受樂故，又復不為一切眾生生慈悲故。
translation: In the lower gods, there's often dissipation, and in the higher gods, meditation is powerful, quiescent meditation is weak, and birth isn't sought because of enjoyment, and compassion isn't shown for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 菩薩不然，但為教化諸眾生故，生兜率天。
translation: Otherwise, the bodhisattvas are born in the Tuṣita Heaven for the purpose of teaching sentient beings.

source_sentence: 下界諸天為聽法故，上兜率天，聽受於法；上界諸天復為法故，亦有下來兜率陀天，聽受於法。
translation: The gods of the lower realms go up to Tuṣita Heaven to hear the teaching, and the gods of the upper realms also go down to Tuṣita Heaven to hear the teaching for the sake of the teaching.

source_sentence: 「然此菩薩，亦生兜率，其兜率陀所居諸天，即喚菩薩，名為護明，以是因緣，號為護明。
translation: "Still, this bodhisattva was born in Tuṣita, and the gods where Tuṣita resides called the bodhisattva, who was called Guoming, because of this cause and condition.

source_sentence: 諸天展轉，稱喚護明，其聲上徹至淨居天，及到阿迦膩吒天頂。
translation: The gods in turn called out to Hao Ming, and their voices went up to the Pure Land Heaven and up to the top of Akaniṣṭha Heaven.

source_sentence: 時諸天等，皆同唱言：『護明菩薩，已來生於兜率天中。』
translation: The gods then all spoke together, saying, 'The Bodhisattva Vermilion Light has been born in Tuṣita Heaven.'

source_sentence: 此聲下至三十三天，乃至達到四天王天，并復徹諸阿修羅宮，各共相謂：『護明菩薩，已得上生兜率陀天。』
translation: That sound went down to the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, up to the Four Heavenly Kings, and into the palaces of the asuras, each saying, 'The Bodhisattva Vipulya has been born up in the Tuṣita Heaven.'

source_sentence: 極下至於阿修羅宮，最上到彼阿迦尼吒，皆悉來集兜率陀天，聚於護明菩薩宮所，聽受於法。
translation: From the lowest to the palace of the asuras and the highest to Akaniṣṭha, they all gathered at the Tuṣita Heaven, gathered at the palace of the Bodhisattva Prabhāpāla, and listened to the teaching.

source_sentence: 護明菩薩既生兜率，其兜率陀諸天宮殿，光明照耀自然莊嚴，更復出於無量無邊莊嚴之事，皆由護明菩薩功德威神力故。
translation: After the Prabhūta Bodhisattva was born in Tuṣita, the palaces of the Tuṣita gods shone with natural splendor and adornment, and measureless and limitless adornments were produced because of the Prabhūta Bodhisattva's merits and authoritative power.

source_sentence: 大梵天王及大威德阿修羅等，皆悉集來兜率天中，前後圍繞護明菩薩。
translation: The great brahma god kings and the great majestic asuras all gathered in the Tuṣita Heaven to surround the Prabhūtaratna Bodhisattva from front to back.

source_sentence: 復有無量無邊眾生，託生兜率，得見最勝最妙五欲，心迷忘失，不憶本行及以先業。
translation: There are measureless and limitless sentient beings who are entrusted with birth in Tuṣita and attain the vision of the five most excellent and wonderful desires, but their minds are deluded and forgetful, and they don't recall their past lives or their prior actions.

source_sentence: 護明菩薩生兜率天，設見最勝最妙五欲，心不迷惑，不曾忘失，正念本緣，乃至為化諸眾生故，住兜率天，天數壽命，滿四千歲，為彼諸天，說法教化，顯示法相，令心歡喜。
translation: When he's born in the Tuṣita Heaven, the Protective Mantra Bodhisattva sees the five most excellent and wonderful desires, doesn't become confused or forgetful in his mind, correctly remembers his former causes, and so he abides in the Tuṣita Heaven for the purpose of teaching sentient beings, with a heavenly lifespan of 4,000 years or more, teaching and transforming those gods, revealing the characteristics of the Dharma, and making their hearts rejoice.

source_sentence: 自餘眾生生彼天者，或以往昔不清淨業故生其中，或復橫死不滿天壽。
translation: Those remaining sentient beings may be born in that heaven because of impure actions in the past, or they may die horribly and not attain a heavenly life span.

source_sentence: 護明菩薩過去修行清淨業因，復為教化諸眾生故，盡兜率天所有壽命，是故稱言希有希有不可思議，又復得於不思議法，護明菩薩盡彼天年。
translation: Because he cultivated pure activities in the past and taught sentient beings, the Dharmapālita Bodhisattva extinguishes their entire life span in Tuṣita Heaven.

source_sentence: 「爾時，護明菩薩大士天壽滿已，自然而有五衰相現。
translation: "At the time, after he had reached the end of his heavenly life, the great luminous bodhisattva naturally experienced the appearance of five signs of decay.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者頭上花萎，二者腋下汗出，三者衣裳垢膩，四者身失威光，五者不樂本座。
translation: One, a flower on his head withers, two, sweat escapes from his armpits, three, his clothing gets dirty, four, his body loses its dignified glow, and five, he doesn't enjoy his seat.

source_sentence: 時兜率天，見彼護明衰相現已，出大音聲，嗚呼嗚呼！
translation: When the Tuṣita Heaven sees this decrepit protector of his luminosity in action, it produces a loud, resonant sound, wailing, wailing!

source_sentence: 共相謂言：『苦哉苦哉！
translation: They all said to each other, 'Oh, my, my!

source_sentence: 護明菩薩不久應當捨離於此兜率天宮，退失威神。
translation: Soon, the luminous-protecting bodhisattva will abandon this palace in Tuṣita Heaven and lose his authority.

source_sentence: 我等今者何可得住？』
translation: How can we stay here now?'

source_sentence: 是時，彼處兜率天眾，唯聞哭聲，諸天宮殿聲響相接，此聲乃至上色界頂首陀會天，阿迦膩吒諸天眾等，各相謂言：『嗚呼哀哉！
translation: At the time, the only sound heard by the Dhṛtarāṣṭra celestials was the sound of wailing, which was heard from the palaces and halls of the gods, up to the highest gods of the form realm, the gods of Akaniṣṭha, and so forth, each saying, 'Oh, woe!

source_sentence: 護明菩薩今已現於五種衰相，不久墜落，從兜率下。』
translation: Now, the guardian of luminosity bodhisattva has shown five signs of decay, and he'll soon fall down from Tuṣita.'

source_sentence: 及修羅宮，嗚呼之聲，其音遍滿，處處唯聞，不久墮落。
translation: The sound of their cries filled the palace of Shura, and it was heard everywhere, for they would soon fall down.

source_sentence: 是時諸天，聞此聲已，阿迦膩吒、他化自在色欲天等，並各下來至兜率天，夜摩諸天、四天王天，聞此聲已，皆悉集聚上兜率天。
translation: When the gods heard that sound, Akaniṣṭha and the Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods each descended to the Tuṣita Heaven, and the Yama gods and the four heavenly kings all gathered up in the Tuṣita Heaven after hearing it.

source_sentence: 如是，乃至龍王、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊陀羅、摩睺羅伽、鳩槃荼、羅剎等地居諸天，屬色欲界諸天攝者，皆悉飛騰上兜率天，集聚一處，共相謂言：『我等今見護明天子，欲從兜率下生人間，其兜率天衰相現時，即人間數有十二年。』
translation: Thus, even the dragon kings, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnas, mahoragas, kumbhāṇḍas, rāṣas, and other gods living on the earth who are included in the form and desire realms all soared up to the Tuṣita Heaven and gathered in one place, saying, 'Now, we've seen the goddess of protection wanting to descend from Tuṣita to the human realm, and when the decrepitude of the Tuṣita Heaven manifests, it will be twelve years since the human realm began.'

source_sentence: 時，首陀會一切諸天，作如是念：『我昔曾見補處菩薩兜率天下生人間時，與此無異。
translation: All the gods of the Śuddhâvāsa assembly then had this thought, 'I've seen the Tendrils Bodhisattva descend from Tuṣita Heaven to be born among humans in the past, and it wasn't different from this.

source_sentence: 彼等諸天，今見護明菩薩大士五衰相現，必定知下於閻浮提。』
translation: Now, all those gods who see the five signs of decay of the Bodhisattva Protector of Light surely know that he's descended to Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 即發大聲，唱如是言：『人等莊嚴於此剎土，菩薩大士不久從彼兜率天來下生此處，掃治掃治，佛欲下生。』
translation: They then raised their voices and called out in a loud voice, saying, 'People, we've adorned this land, and it won't be long before the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva comes down from Tuṣita Heaven to be born here, sweeping and purifying as the Buddha desires to descend.'

source_sentence: 是時，此間閻浮提地，有五百辟支佛，在一林中，修道居住。
translation: At the time, there were five hundred pratyekabuddhas living here in Jambudvīpa in a forest, cultivating and abiding there.

source_sentence: 時彼五百辟支佛，聞此聲已，飛騰虛空，相共往詣波羅[木*奈]城。
translation: After hearing this sound, those five hundred pratyekabuddhas soared through the sky and traveled together to the city of [Mokṣala].

source_sentence: 至彼處已，各各示現五種神通，踊身虛空，出於烟焰，次第說偈，捨於壽命，入般涅槃。
translation: When they arrived there, they each demonstrated five kinds of supernormal powers, swarmed into space, emerged from the smoke and flames, spoke verses in sequence, abandoned their lives, and entered parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 「爾時護明菩薩大士，見彼天眾及梵釋天、護世、諸龍、毘舍闍等，觀察彼眾，心意泰然，不恐不驚，不疑不畏，出柔軟語，而告之言：『汝諸仁者！
translation: "At the time, the great luminous protector bodhisattva saw that crowd of gods, Brahmā gods, guardian gods, dragons, and piśācīs, and so forth, observed them with calmness of mind, not fearing or alarming, not doubting or fearing, and speaking softly, and addressed them, saying, 'You gentlemen!

source_sentence: 各各當知！
translation: Each one should know!

source_sentence: 如我今見有此五種衰相出時，不久從於兜率天下生於人間。』
translation: Now, when I see these five signs of decay, I'll soon be born here among humans from Tuṣita Heaven.'

source_sentence: 時梵釋等諸天報言：『尊者護明！
translation: Brahmā and the other gods then reported, 'Venerable Guomin!

source_sentence: 如尊所見，五種衰相出現之者，尊必不久當下兜率生於人間，尊可憶念昔本行願。』
translation: 'As you see, someone with five signs of decay will surely go down to Tuṣita and be born among humans soon, so you can remember your past vows.'

source_sentence: 時彼無量百千天眾，發是語已，遍體戰慄，身毛皆竪，心大驚怖，合十指掌，頂禮護明。
translation: After those measureless hundreds of thousands of gods spoke those words, their bodies shook with fear, their hair stood on end, and their hearts were greatly frightened as they joined their palms with ten fingers and bowed their heads to Hao Ming.

source_sentence: 「爾時，護明告彼眾言：『我今必下，決定無疑。
translation: "It was then that the guardian luminaries told the crowd, 'Now, I will surely descend, without question.

source_sentence: 時今已至，是故汝等應念無常，當想未來恐怖之事，汝等善觀身體穢污，心強愛著，以是諸欲共相纏繞，於生死中，不得出離。
translation: Now that the time has come, you should therefore be mindful of impermanence and think about future horrors, and you should well observe that your bodies are defiled, that your minds are strongly attached to them, and that because of these desires and common entanglements, you won't be able to escape in birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 如是臭形，甚可厭惡。
translation: Such a foul-smelling form is disgusting.

source_sentence: 汝等一切，合十指掌，觀我身體，及諸眾生，相與未能免脫此法。
translation: All of you, put your palms together with your ten fingers and look at my body and all the sentient beings who are together unable to escape this thing.

source_sentence: 是故汝等為我莫愁，為我莫苦。』
translation: Therefore, don't be sad for me, and don't suffer for me.'

source_sentence: 彼諸天言：『尊者護明！
translation: The gods said, 'Venerable Prabhūtaratna, guard your luminosity!

source_sentence: 唯願尊者慈悲普覆，亦莫更生其餘諸心，但念往昔本誓因緣，億劫生身，尊亦曾受天人業果。
translation: May Your Holiness's compassion be universal, and don't revive any other minds, but remember the causes and conditions of past vows, the billions of eons of birth, and the fact that Your Holiness was once subject to the results of karma as a god or human being.

source_sentence: 往昔所造善業因緣，憶念彼施善根法行，於諸眾生，生慈悲心。』
translation: Remembering the causes and conditions of the good actions created in the past and recalling his practice of bestowing good roots and qualities, he gives rise to a mind of compassion for all sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 護明菩薩，報諸天言：『汝等當知！
translation: Protecting his luminosity, the bodhisattva reprimanded the gods, saying, 'You should know!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，於世間中及以生處，但令是有，但令是生，不免分離，況復於我？
translation: All sentient beings, in the world and in the place where they are born, are only made to exist and are only made to arise, and they are not exempt from being separated, so how could it be for me?

source_sentence: 又諸眾生，皆悉無常，恩愛別離，云何得脫？』
translation: How can all sentient beings be liberated when they are all impermanent and separated by affection?'

source_sentence: 「是時，諸天復更白言：『希有希有！
translation: "At that point, the gods again said, 'Rarely, rarely!'

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Dharma Protector!

source_sentence: 難可思議，能於無常境界之中，臨捨壽時，心得辯才，一種達解，無有別異。
translation: It's hard to fathom that someone could be so knowledgeable and eloquent when they're approaching the end of their life in an impermanent realm that there's no difference between one kind of understanding and another.

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Hồng Hu Ming!

source_sentence: 又復一切自餘諸天，見此五種衰相現時，心即憂愁，失於正念。』
translation: Again, when all the other gods see these five signs of decay, their minds are distressed, and they lose their right mindfulness.'

source_sentence: 護明菩薩復更重告諸天眾言：『一生補處諸菩薩等，善根增長，知諸有處，於功德中寂定其心，苦來逼切不生諸惱，乃至不隨諸苦而行，能於一切諸眾生邊，起大慈悲。』
translation: Again, the luminous-protecting bodhisattva repeatedly addressed the gods, saying, 'Suppose there are bodhisattvas in the vicinity of one life who have developed good roots, know the various places of existence, are calm and collected in their minds amidst their virtues, aren't afflicted by the oppression of suffering, and don't act according to suffering, and are capable of generating great compassion for all sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 時諸天言：『如是如是！
translation: The gods then said, 'So it is!

source_sentence: 尊者護明！
translation: Venerable Dharma Protector!

source_sentence: 一切眾生，於彼人間，種諸善根，生此天宮，此處福盡，還即退下。』
translation: All sentient beings who planted good roots among humans and were born in this celestial palace will end their merits here and retreat back down.'

source_sentence: 「護明菩薩復告天言：『我以是故，見人天中有是過失。
translation: "Again, the Protective Mantra Bodhisattva told the gods, 'It's because of this that I've seen such faults among humans and gods.

source_sentence: 我今從此下生人間，為諸世間一切眾生，滅盡諸苦。』
translation: Now, I've descended from here to the human realm to end suffering for all sentient beings in the world.'

source_sentence: 是時彼中，有一天女，愛樂戀著護明菩薩，復更別告一天女言：『我等可至閻浮提中觀我大家護明菩薩，於何處生？』
translation: Then, there was a goddess among them who was delightfully attached to the luminous protection bodhisattva and again told the goddess, 'May we go to Jambudvīpa and see where we, the luminous protection bodhisattva, will be born?'

source_sentence: 彼天女言：『我今亦樂於閻浮提。
translation: The goddess said, 'Now, I'm also happy in Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我之大家欲生彼處，是故我亦願在彼間。』
translation: My whole family wants to be born there; therefore, I also wish to be there.'

source_sentence: 時二天女，復相謂言：『我亦不為此大家故，願往生彼。
translation: The two goddesses then again said to each other, 'I don't want to be born there for the sake of this large family.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我此大家往閻浮提，則有無量無邊眾生種諸善根，於中信受，而行教化，復有無量無邊眾生，修諸福業，來生此處。』
translation: If I were to send all of you to Jambudvīpa, then measureless and limitless sentient beings would plant good roots, accept them faithfully, and carry out teachings, and measureless and limitless sentient beings would cultivate good actions and come to be born here.'

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 5
